summary: This is an email chain from April 2020 among U.S. Attorney's Office personnel in the Southern District of New York discussing the prosecution memo for the Ghislaine Maxwell investigation and scheduling a conference call to discuss the draft indictment.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The investigation and prosecution memo are focused on her, indicating she is the target of a criminal case being prepared by the U.S. Attorney's Office.

events.title: Prosecution memo completion for Maxwell investigation
events.description: The prosecution memo for the Ghislaine Maxwell investigation was completed and submitted by the team.

events.title: Scheduled conference call on Maxwell indictment
events.description: A conference call was scheduled for 1pm on Wednesday (April 15, 2020) to discuss the draft indictment for Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations.context: Address of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, where the correspondence originated.

keyFacts: A prosecution memo for the Ghislaine Maxwell investigation was completed and submitted by April 10, 2020.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively working on a draft indictment for Maxwell in April 2020.
A conference call was scheduled for April 15, 2020, to discuss the draft indictment among the prosecution team and chiefs.
The document shows coordinated planning within the U.S. Attorney's Office to advance the criminal case against Maxwell.
The email chain indicates the prosecution was in an advanced preparatory stage, moving from investigation to indictment drafting.
